intro: Holodiscus argenteus, commonly known as silver disc, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. Holodiscus argenteus prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
